description.value: The Bandit Lord makes two attacks with his battleaxe, one attack with his handaxe, and uses one of his abilities, if he has one to use.
This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.
Once per long rest, as a bonus action, you can command up to 5 allies of your choice within 60 ft. of you, allowing them to immediately move up to their speed using their reaction.
You designate up to three allies. All three can make an additional attack or cast a cantrip as their reaction.
An Elite creature counts as two monsters of a given level. It has +2 to all saves, as well as twice as many hit points and twice as much damage as a typical monster of its level.

The knight's horse is counted as part of the knight. If 20 damage is done specifically to the horse, it dies, and the knight is knocked prone. If an area of effect spell does at least 20 damage to the knight, the horse also dies. The knight's speed is now 30 ft. The horse has an AC of 11.

Battleaxes are large, one or two handed axes meant for melee combat.

Properties:

&Reference[Versatile] (1d10)

Handaxes are balanced for slashing and for throwing. Designed to be wielded with one hand, they are designed for combat, rather than prolonged use as a tool.

Properties:

&reference[light weapon], &Reference[Thrown]
